title: Direction
text: We can tell whether the parabola goes up or down based on the sign of a in the equation, $$y=a x^2+b x+c$$. If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.
speech: We can tell whether the parabola goes up or down based on the sign of a in the equation,  y is equal to a x squared, plus b x plus c . If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.

. If a is negative, then the parabola goes downwards, if it is positive, it goes upwards.

title: Direction
text: Since our a is positive, what does this tell us about our parabola?

title: Upwards Direction
text: Since our a is positive, we know that our parabola will open up upwards.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: To find the vertex, we need to find the axis is symmetry, which is found using the formula, $$x=\frac{-b}{2} a$$.

title: Finding the Axis of Symmetry
text: Our $$b$$ and a are $$2$$ and $$6$$ respectively. Our axis of symmetry is $$x=6\frac{-2}{2}$$.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Now that we have our axis of symmetry, we want to plug it back into the original equation to find the $$y$$ value of our vertex.

title: Finding the Vertex
text: Since our $$x$$ is $$\frac{-1}{6}$$, we plug it into our equation as, $$y=-\left({\left(-\frac{1}{6}\right)}^2\right)+2\left(-\frac{1}{6}\right)-1$$. This gives us $$y=\frac{-7}{6}$$.

title: Vertex

title: Finding the y-intercepts
text: Our y-intercept occurs when $$x=0$$. Knowing this, we substitute $$0$$ into our equation.

title: Finding the y-intercepts

title: Finding the x-intercepts
text: We must factor the GCF from our equation and factor the trinomial. After this, we solve for $$x$$, which are $$-0.608$$ and $$0.274$$ in this case, so the x-intercepts are $$(-0.608, 0)$$ and $$(0.274, 0)$$.
